snippet: A sensor designed by scientists at Duke University uses metamaterials, which bend radiation in unusual ways, to compress images more efficiently than technologies like JPEG.
abstract: Duke University scientists, writing in journal Science, report creation of a new sensor that compresses images far more efficiently than existing technologies like JPEG; highly-efficient technology presents wide range of possible applications.
lead_paragraph: A sensor designed by scientists at Duke University uses metamaterials, which bend radiation in unusual ways, to compress images more efficiently than technologies like JPEG.

headline.seo: Duke Researchers Develop a New Way to Compress Images
headline.main: Scientists Develop Device for Image Compression
headline.print_headline: Scientists Develop Device For Image Compression
